data.title: Coaching Staff
data.text:
He is currently Harvard-Westlake’s Head of Program for Boys’ Basketball. Before coming to Harvard-Westlake, Rebibo was hired as an Assistant Men’s Basketball Coach for the University of San Francisco in 2013. While on staff, USF finished second in the West Coast Conference for the first time in 20 years and earned a berth to the NIT. Prior to his stint in the NCAA, Rebibo was the Head Basketball Coach at El Camino Real High School from 2007-13. While at El Camino Real, Rebibo and ECR made the CIF City Section quarter-finals in 2009, the finals and the state tournament in 2010, and the semi-finals in 2011. ECR earned the CIF City Section championship and the regional semi-final in 2012 and the City Section division I finals and “Open Division” state playoffs in 2013. Rebibo was also named the City Section division II Coach of the Year in 2012 and the LA Daily News Coach of the Year in 2013. In his first year at Harvard-Westlake, Rebibo guided his team to the semi-final of the CIF-SS finals and won the Division IV CA State Championship in March, 2016. In his second year the Wolverines won the CIF-SS DIA Title and Rebibo was named Division I Coach of the Year. A native of Los Angeles, Rebibo played collegiately for Pierce College and Cal State Northridge, with a B.A. in psychology from CSUN and a Master’s degree in Education from National University.

Born and raised in Philadelphia Pa. played football and basketball at John Bartram High school. After moving west to attend Sonoma State University where he played football. Coach Lewis relocated to Los Angeles where he began his over 25yrs of coaching youth basketball at the Inglewood YMCA. The Rancho YBL, The Willows Community School. Marlborough School where he became head of basketball operations and finally settled at Harvard Westlake School were he coached at the middle school for 4yrs and has been the assistant freshman coach for the past 2yrs. Lewis’s commitment to teaching young athletes the fundamentals of basketball as well as life has been the most rewarding part of his coaching career.

Coach Garton enters his 19th year of coaching high school basketball which includes stops at all levels. Starting as a Freshman Coach at Simi Valley High School, Garton continued to coach for the Pioneers for 12 season which included 6 Marmonte league titles and 2 Ventura County Coach of the Year awards. With successful roles on the Frosh/Soph, JV and Varsity teams, Garton took the role as program head coach on a couple occasions. First at Fulton College Prep who was beginning an inaugural program and then for Cleveland High School who wanted to get back to the glory days of producing NBA players. On top of coaching the high school teams, Chris also gained the experience of Travel AAU basketball when coaching for the Power house, Pump n Run basketball.

With this experience, Garton joined Coach Rebibo at Harvard-Westlake as an assistant coach who has since won a CIF and State Championship, and been ranked at the National level. With Division 1 players and Championship aspirations Garton will continue the drive and ambitions of the HW way for the Wolverines and LABC basketball

Chris is also a Middle School PE teacher at Porter Middle School in Granada Hills. He lives in Canyon Country with his wife Scarleth and 3-year-old son, Kristian.
